column3: A short description of the Technique
Alternative names, acronyms, or full names if the preferred label is the acronym (not all techniques have acronym)
Allowing parent child connections - Imaging, Point-spectroscopy, 2D, 3D,  (- a controlled list connected to the IPERION-HS Catalogue of Access Services)
The properties or dimensions (entities) for which the technique identifies or measures values - composition, width, roughness, surface, tension, colour, life expectation, etc .
The main type(s) or category(ies) of materials for which the Technique can provide with information.
A list of relevant analytical outputs that can be obtained with the Technique.

A list of relevant references (Papers or books chapters) relating to the principles and application of the Technique to the examination of different objects/materials  - ideally a list of DOIs or similar resolvable PIDs.
